actions.text: Referred to Senate Committee on Finance.

official_title: A bill to provide that an individual who has attained age 65 will not be required to pay the social security tax on his first $2,400 of wages and self-employment income.
subjects: Old age, survivors and disability insurance

summary.text: Provides, under the Internal Revenue Code, that an individual who has attained the age of 65 will not be required to pay the social security tax (FICA or Self-Employment Contributions Act) on his first $2,400 of wages and self-employment income, respectively.

titles.title: A bill to provide that an individual who has attained age 65 will not be required to pay the social security tax on his first $2,400 of wages and self-employment income.
